intro: Koanophyllon turquinense, commonly known as the Turquino leafcurl, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and is often referred to as the daisy or sunflower family. The plant is known for its distinctive, curled leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in high-altitude environments, typically in rocky or arid soils, and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
